play.title: The Tragedy of Othello, the Moor of Venice

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: What is the reason of this terrible summons?
What is the matter there?

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Signior, is all your family within?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Are your doors lock’d?

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: Why? Wherefore ask you this?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: ’Zounds, sir, y’ are robb’d! For shame, put on your gown;
Your heart is burst, you have lost half your soul;
Even now, now, very now, an old black ram
Is tupping your white ewe. Arise, arise!
Awake the snorting citizens with the bell,
Or else the devil will make a grandsire of you.
Arise, I say!

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: What, have you lost your wits?

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Most reverend signior, do you know my voice?

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: Not I; what are you?

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: My name is Roderigo.

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: The worser welcome;
I have charg’d thee not to haunt about my doors.
In honest plainness thou hast heard me say
My daughter is not for thee; and now, in madness
(Being full of supper and distemp’ring draughts),
Upon malicious bravery dost thou come
To start my quiet.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Sir, sir, sir—

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: But thou must needs be sure
My spirits and my place have in their power
To make this bitter to thee.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Patience, good sir.

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: What tell’st thou me of robbing? This is Venice;
My house is not a grange.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Most grave Brabantio,
In simple and pure soul I come to you.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: ’Zounds, sir, you are one of those that will not serve God, if the devil bid you. Because we come to do you service, and you think we are ruffians, you’ll have your daughter cover’d with a Barbary horse, you’ll have your nephews neigh to you; you’ll have coursers for cousins, and gennets for germans.

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: What profane wretch art thou?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: I am one, sir, that comes to tell you your daughter and the Moor are now making the beast with two backs.

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: Thou art a villain.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: You are a senator.

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: This thou shalt answer; I know thee, Roderigo.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Sir, I will answer any thing. But I beseech you,
If’t be your pleasure and most wise consent
(As partly I find it is) that your fair daughter,
At this odd-even and dull watch o’ th’ night,
Transported with no worse nor better guard
But with a knave of common hire, a gundolier,
To the gross clasps of a lascivious Moor—
If this be known to you, and your allowance,
We then have done you bold and saucy wrongs;
But if you know not this, my manners tell me
We have your wrong rebuke. Do not believe
That, from the sense of all civility,
I thus would play and trifle with your reverence.
Your daughter (if you have not given her leave),
I say again, hath made a gross revolt,
Tying her duty, beauty, wit, and fortunes
In an extravagant and wheeling stranger
Of here and every where. Straight satisfy yourself.
If she be in her chamber or your house,
Let loose on me the justice of the state
For thus deluding you.

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: Strike on the tinder, ho!
Give me a taper! Call up all my people!
This accident is not unlike my dream,
Belief of it oppresses me already.
Light, I say, light!

stagedir.dir: Enter below Brabantio in his night-gown with Servants and torches.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Though in the trade of war I have slain men,
Yet do I hold it very stuff o’ th’ conscience
To do no contriv’d murder. I lack iniquity
Sometime to do me service. Nine or ten times
I had thought t’ have yerk’d him here under the ribs.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: ’Tis better as it is.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Nay, but he prated,
And spoke such scurvy and provoking terms
Against your honor,
That with the little godliness I have
I did full hard forbear him. But I pray you, sir,
Are you fast married? Be assur’d of this,
That the magnifico is much belov’d,
And hath in his effect a voice potential
As double as the Duke’s. He will divorce you,
Or put upon you what restraint or grievance
The law (with all his might to enforce it on)
Will give him cable.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Let him do his spite;
My services which I have done the signiory
Shall out—tongue his complaints. ’Tis yet to know—
Which, when I know that boasting is an honor,
I shall provulgate—I fetch my life and being
From men of royal siege, and my demerits
May speak, unbonneted, to as proud a fortune
As this that I have reach’d; for know, Iago,
But that I love the gentle Desdemona,
I would not my unhoused free condition
Put into circumscription and confine
For the sea’s worth. But look, what lights come yond?

stagedir.dir: Enter Cassio with Officers and torches.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Ancient, what makes he here?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Faith, he tonight hath boarded a land carrack.
If it prove lawful prize, he’s made forever.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I do not understand.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: He’s married.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: To who?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: It is Brabantio. General, be advis’d,
He comes to bad intent.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Holla, stand there!

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Signior, it is the Moor.

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: Down with him, thief!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: You, Roderigo! Come, sir, I am for you.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Keep up your bright swords, for the dew will rust them.
Good signior, you shall more command with years
Than with your weapons.

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: O thou foul thief, where hast thou stow’d my daughter?
Damn’d as thou art, thou hast enchanted her,
For I’ll refer me to all things of sense,
If she in chains of magic were not bound,
Whether a maid so tender, fair, and happy,
So opposite to marriage that she shunn’d
The wealthy curled darlings of our nation,
Would ever have, t’ incur a general mock,
Run from her guardage to the sooty bosom
Of such a thing as thou—to fear, not to delight!
Judge me the world, if ’tis not gross in sense,
That thou hast practic’d on her with foul charms,
Abus’d her delicate youth with drugs or minerals
That weakens motion. I’ll have’t disputed on,
’Tis probable, and palpable to thinking.
I therefore apprehend and do attach thee
For an abuser of the world, a practicer
Of arts inhibited and out of warrant.
Lay hold upon him, if he do resist
Subdue him at his peril.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Hold your hands,
Both you of my inclining, and the rest.
Were it my cue to fight, I should have known it
Without a prompter. Whither will you that I go
To answer this your charge?

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: To prison, till fit time
Of law and course of direct session
Call thee to answer.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: What if I do obey?
How may the Duke be therewith satisfied,
Whose messengers are here about my side,
Upon some present business of the state,
To bring me to him?

speech.speaker: OFF.
speech.line: ’Tis true, most worthy signior;
The Duke’s in council, and your noble self
I am sure is sent for.

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: How? The Duke in council?
In this time of the night? Bring him away;
Mine’s not an idle cause. The Duke himself,
Or any of my brothers of the state,
Cannot but feel this wrong as ’twere their own;
For if such actions may have passage free,
Bond-slaves and pagans shall our statesmen be.

stagedir.dir: Enter Duke and Senators set at a table, with lights and Officers.

speech.speaker: OFF.
speech.line: A messenger from the galleys.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Now? What’s the business?

speech.speaker: SAIL.
speech.line: The Turkish preparation makes for Rhodes,
So was I bid report here to the state
By Signior Angelo.

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: The Ottomites, reverend and gracious,
Steering with due course toward the isle of Rhodes,
Have there injointed them with an after fleet.

speech.speaker: 1. SEN.
speech.line: Ay, so I thought. How many, as you guess?

speech.speaker: 1. MESS.
speech.line: Of thirty sail; and now they do restem
Their backward course, bearing with frank appearance
Their purposes toward Cyprus. Signior Montano,
Your trusty and most valiant servitor,
With his free duty recommends you thus,
And prays you to believe him.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Valiant Othello, we must straight employ you
Against the general enemy Ottoman.
What, in your own part, can you say to this?

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: Nothing, but this is so.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Most potent, grave, and reverend signiors,
My very noble and approv’d good masters:
That I have ta’en away this old man’s daughter,
It is most true; true I have married her;
The very head and front of my offending
Hath this extent, no more. Rude am I in my speech,
And little bless’d with the soft phrase of peace;
For since these arms of mine had seven years’ pith,
Till now some nine moons wasted, they have us’d
Their dearest action in the tented field;
And little of this great world can I speak
More than pertains to feats of broils and battle,
And therefore little shall I grace my cause
In speaking for myself. Yet (by your gracious patience)
I will a round unvarnish’d tale deliver
Of my whole course of love—what drugs, what charms,
What conjuration, and what mighty magic
(For such proceeding I am charg’d withal)
I won his daughter.

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: A maiden, never bold;
Of spirit so still and quiet that her motion
Blush’d at herself; and she, in spite of nature,
Of years, of country, credit, every thing,
To fall in love with what she fear’d to look on!
It is a judgment main’d, and most imperfect,
That will confess perfection so could err
Against all rules of nature, and must be driven
To find out practices of cunning hell
Why this should be. I therefore vouch again
That with some mixtures pow’rful o’er the blood,
Or with some dram (conjur’d to this effect)
He wrought upon her.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: To vouch this is no proof,
Without more wider and more overt test
Than these thin habits and poor likelihoods
Of modern seeming do prefer against him.

speech.speaker: 1. SEN.
speech.line: But, Othello, speak.
Did you by indirect and forced courses
Subdue and poison this young maid’s affections?
Or came it by request, and such fair question
As soul to soul affordeth?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: I do beseech you,
Send for the lady to the Sagittary,
And let her speak of me before her father.
If you do find me foul in her report,
The trust, the office I do hold of you,
Not only take away, but let your sentence
Even fall upon my life.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Fetch Desdemona hither.

scene.line: And, till she come, as truly as to heaven
I do confess the vices of my blood,
So justly to your grave ears I’ll present
How I did thrive in this fair lady’s love,
And she in mine.

speech.speaker: DUKE.
speech.line: Say it, Othello.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Her father lov’d me, oft invited me;
Still question’d me the story of my life
From year to year—the battles, sieges, fortunes,
That I have pass’d.
I ran it through, even from my boyish days
To th’ very moment that he bade me tell it;
Wherein I spoke of most disastrous chances:
Of moving accidents by flood and field,
Of hair-breadth scapes i’ th’ imminent deadly breach,
Of being taken by the insolent foe
And sold to slavery, of my redemption thence
And portance in my travel’s history;
Wherein of antres vast and deserts idle,
Rough quarries, rocks, and hills whose heads touch heaven,
It was my hint to speak—such was my process—
And of the Cannibals that each other eat,
The Anthropophagi, and men whose heads
Do grow beneath their shoulders. These things to hear
Would Desdemona seriously incline;
But still the house affairs would draw her thence,
Which ever as she could with haste dispatch,
She’ld come again, and with a greedy ear
Devour up my discourse. Which I observing,
Took once a pliant hour, and found good means
To draw from her a prayer of earnest heart
That I would all my pilgrimage dilate,
Whereof by parcels she had something heard,
But not intentively. I did consent,
And often did beguile her of her tears,
When I did speak of some distressful stroke
That my youth suffer’d. My story being done,
She gave me for my pains a world of sighs;
She swore, in faith ’twas strange, ’twas passing strange;
’Twas pitiful, ’twas wondrous pitiful.
She wish’d she had not heard it, yet she wish’d
That heaven had made her such a man. She thank’d me,
And bade me, if I had a friend that lov’d her,
I should but teach him how to tell my story,
And that would woo her. Upon this hint I spake:
She lov’d me for the dangers I had pass’d,
And I lov’d her that she did pity them.
This only is the witchcraft I have us’d.
Here comes the lady; let her witness it.

scene.line: And, noble signior,
If virtue no delighted beauty lack,
Your son-in-law is far more fair than black.

speech.speaker: 1. SEN.
speech.line: Adieu, brave Moor, use Desdemona well.

speech.speaker: BRA.
speech.line: Look to her, Moor, if thou hast eyes to see;
She has deceiv’d her father, and may thee.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Iago—

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: What say’st thou, noble heart?

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: What will I do, think’st thou?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Why, go to bed and sleep.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: I will incontinently drown myself.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: If thou dost, I shall never love thee after. Why, thou silly gentleman?

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: It is silliness to live, when to live is torment; and then have we a prescription to die, when death is our physician.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: O villainous! I have look’d upon the world for four times seven years, and since I could distinguish betwixt a benefit and an injury, I never found man that knew how to love himself. Ere I would say I would drown myself for the love of a guinea hen, I would change my humanity with a baboon.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: What should I do? I confess it is my shame to be so fond, but it is not in my virtue to amend it.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Virtue? A fig! ’Tis in ourselves that we are thus or thus. Our bodies are our gardens, to the which our wills are gardeners; so that if we will plant nettles or sow lettuce, set hyssop and weed up tine, supply it with one gender of herbs or distract it with many, either to have it sterile with idleness or manur’d with industry—why, the power and corrigible authority of this lies in our wills. If the beam of our lives had not one scale of reason to poise another of sensuality, the blood and baseness of our natures would conduct us to most prepost’rous conclusions. But we have reason to cool our raging motions, our carnal stings, our unbitted lusts; whereof I take this that you call love to be a sect or scion.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: It cannot be.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: It is merely a lust of the blood and a permission of the will. Come, be a man! Drown thyself? Drown cats and blind puppies! I have profess’d me thy friend, and I confess me knit to thy deserving with cables of perdurable toughness. I could never better stead thee than now. Put money in thy purse; follow thou the wars; defeat thy favor with an usurp’d beard. I say put money in thy purse. It cannot be long that Desdemona should continue her love to the Moor—put money in thy purse—nor he his to her. It was a violent commencement in her, and thou shalt see an answerable sequestration—put but money in thy purse. These Moors are changeable in their wills—fill thy purse with money. The food that to him now is as luscious as locusts, shall be to him shortly as acerb as the coloquintida. She must change for youth; when she is sated with his body, she will find the error of her choice. She must have change, she must; therefore put money in thy purse. If thou wilt needs damn thyself, do it a more delicate way than drowning. Make all the money thou canst. If sanctimony and a frail vow betwixt an erring barbarian and a super-subtle Venetian be not too hard for my wits and all the tribe of hell, thou shalt enjoy her; therefore make money. A pox of drowning thyself, it is clean out of the way. Seek thou rather to be hang’d in compassing thy joy than to be drown’d and go without her.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Wilt thou be fast to my hopes, if I depend on the issue?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Thou art sure of me—go make money. I have told thee often, and I retell thee again and again, I hate the Moor. My cause is hearted; thine hath no less reason. Let us be conjunctive in our revenge against him. If thou canst cuckold him, thou dost thyself a pleasure, me a sport. There are many events in the womb of time which will be deliver’d. Traverse, go, provide thy money. We will have more of this tomorrow. Adieu.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Where shall we meet i’ th’ morning?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: At my lodging.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: I’ll be with thee betimes.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Go to, farewell. Do you hear, Roderigo?

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: What say you?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: No more of drowning, do you hear?

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: I am chang’d.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Go to, farewell. Put money enough in your purse.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: I’ll sell all my land.

speech.speaker: 3. GENT.
speech.line: News, lads! Our wars are done.
The desperate tempest hath so bang’d the Turks,
That their designment halts. A noble ship of Venice
Hath seen a grievous wrack and sufferance
On most part of their fleet.

speech.speaker: MON.
speech.line: How? Is this true?

speech.speaker: 3. GENT.
speech.line: The ship is here put in,
A Veronesa; Michael Cassio,
Lieutenant to the warlike Moor Othello,
Is come on shore; the Moor himself at sea,
And is in full commission here for Cyprus.

speech.speaker: MON.
speech.line: I am glad on’t; ’tis a worthy governor.

speech.speaker: 3. GENT.
speech.line: But this same Cassio, though he speak of comfort
Touching the Turkish loss, yet he looks sadly,
And prays the Moor be safe; for they were parted
With foul and violent tempest.

speech.speaker: MON.
speech.line: Pray heaven he be;
For I have serv’d him, and the man commands
Like a full soldier. Let’s to the sea-side, ho!
As well to see the vessel that’s come in
As to throw out our eyes for brave Othello,
Even till we make the main and th’ aerial blue
An indistinct regard.

speech.speaker: 3. GENT.
speech.line: Come, let’s do so;
For every minute is expectancy
Of more arrivance.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: What noise?

speech.speaker: 2. MESS.
speech.line: The town is empty; on the brow o’ th’ sea
Stand ranks of people, and they cry, “A sail!”

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: My hopes do shape him for the governor.

speech.speaker: 2. GENT.
speech.line: They do discharge their shot of courtesy;
Our friends at least.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I pray you, sir, go forth,
And give us truth who ’tis that is arriv’d.

speech.speaker: 2. GENT.
speech.line: I shall.

scene.line: How now? Who has put in?

speech.speaker: 2. GENT.
speech.line: ’Tis one Iago, ancient to the general.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: H’as had most favorable and happy speed:
Tempests themselves, high seas, and howling winds,
The gutter’d rocks and congregated sands,
Traitors ensteep’d to enclog the guiltless keel,
As having sense of beauty, do omit
Their mortal natures, letting go safely by
The divine Desdemona.

speech.speaker: MON.
speech.line: What is she?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: She that I spake of, our great captain’s captain,
Left in the conduct of the bold Iago,
Whose footing here anticipates our thoughts
A se’nnight’s speed. Great Jove, Othello guard,
And swell his sail with thine own pow’rful breath,
That he may bless this bay with his tall ship,
Make love’s quick pants in Desdemona’s arms,
Give renew’d fire to our extincted spirits,
And bring all Cyprus comfort!

stagedir.dir: Enter Desdemona, Iago, Roderigo, and Emilia, with Attendants.

speech.line: Good ancient, you are welcome.

He takes her by the palm; ay, well said, whisper. With as little a web as this will I ensnare as great a fly as Cassio. Ay, smile upon her, do; I will gyve thee in thine own courtship. You say true, ’tis so indeed. If such tricks as these strip you out of your lieutenantry, it had been better you had not kiss’d your three fingers so oft, which now again you are most apt to play the sir in. Very good; well kiss’d! An excellent courtesy! ’Tis so indeed. Yet again, your fingers to your lips? Would they were clyster-pipes for your sake!

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: O my fair warrior!

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: My dear Othello!

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: It gives me wonder great as my content
To see you here before me. O my soul’s joy!
If after every tempest come such calms,
May the winds blow till they have waken’d death!
And let the laboring bark climb hills of seas
Olympus-high, and duck again as low
As hell’s from heaven! If it were now to die,
’Twere now to be most happy; for I fear
My soul hath her content so absolute
That not another comfort like to this
Succeeds in unknown fate.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: The heavens forbid
But that our loves and comforts should increase
Even as our days do grow!

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Amen to that, sweet powers!
I cannot speak enough of this content,
It stops me here; it is too much of joy.
And this, and this, the greatest discords be
That e’er our hearts shall make!

stagedir.dir: To an Attendant, as he is going out.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: That Cassio loves her, I do well believe’t;
That she loves him, ’tis apt and of great credit.
The Moor (howbeit that I endure him not)
Is of a constant, loving, noble nature,
And I dare think he’ll prove to Desdemona
A most dear husband. Now I do love her too,
Not out of absolute lust (though peradventure
I stand accomptant for as great a sin),
But partly led to diet my revenge,
For that I do suspect the lusty Moor
Hath leap’d into my seat; the thought whereof
Doth (like a poisonous mineral) gnaw my inwards;
And nothing can or shall content my soul
Till I am even’d with him, wife for wife;
Or failing so, yet that I put the Moor
At least into a jealousy so strong
That judgment cannot cure. Which thing to do,
If this poor trash of Venice, whom I trace
For his quick hunting, stand the putting on,
I’ll have our Michael Cassio on the hip,
Abuse him to the Moor in the rank garb
(For I fear Cassio with my night-cap too),
Make the Moor thank me, love me, and reward me,
For making him egregiously an ass,
And practicing upon his peace and quiet
Even to madness. ’Tis here; but yet confus’d,
Knavery’s plain face is never seen till us’d.

speech.speaker: HER.
speech.line: It is Othello’s pleasure, our noble and valiant general, that upon certain tidings now arriv’d, importing the mere perdition of the Turkish fleet, every man put himself into triumph; some to dance, some to make bonfires, each man to what sport and revels his addiction leads him; for besides these beneficial news, it is the celebration of his nuptial. So much was his pleasure should be proclaim’d. All offices are open, and there is full liberty of feasting from this present hour of five till the bell have told eleven. Heaven bless the isle of Cyprus and our noble general Othello!

stagedir.dir: Enter Othello, Desdemona, Cassio, and Attendants.

scene.line: Come, my dear love,
The purchase made, the fruits are to ensue;
That profit’s yet to come ’tween me and you.—
Good night.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Welcome, Iago; we must to the watch.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Not this hour, lieutenant; ’tis not yet ten o’ th’ clock. Our general cast us thus early for the love of his Desdemona; who let us not therefore blame. He hath not yet made wanton the night with her; and she is sport for Jove.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: She’s a most exquisite lady.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: And I’ll warrant her, full of game.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Indeed she’s a most fresh and delicate creature.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: What an eye she has! Methinks it sounds a parley to provocation.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: An inviting eye; and yet methinks right modest.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: And when she speaks, is it not an alarum to love?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: She is indeed perfection.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Well—happiness to their sheets! Come, lieutenant, I have a stoup of wine, and here without are a brace of Cyprus gallants that would fain have a measure to the health of black Othello.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Not tonight, good Iago, I have very poor and unhappy brains for drinking. I could well wish courtesy would invent some other custom of entertainment.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: O, they are our friends—but one cup, I’ll drink for you.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I have drunk but one cup tonight—and that was craftily qualified too—and behold what innovation it makes here. I am infortunate in the infirmity, and dare not task my weakness with any more.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: What, man? ’Tis a night of revels, the gallants desire it.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Where are they?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Here, at the door; I pray you call them in.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I’ll do’t, but it dislikes me.

scene.line: If consequence do but approve my dream,
My boat sails freely, both with wind and stream.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: ’Fore God, they have given me a rouse already.

speech.speaker: MON.
speech.line: Good faith, a little one; not past a pint, as I am a soldier.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Some wine ho!
“And let me the canakin clink, clink;
And let me the canakin clink.
A soldier’s a man;
O, man’s life’s but a span;
Why then let a soldier drink.”
Some wine, boys!

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: ’Fore God, an excellent song.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: I learn’d it in England, where indeed they are most potent in potting; your Dane, your German, and your swag-bellied Hollander—Drink ho!—are nothing to your English.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Is your Englishman so exquisite in his drinking?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Why, he drinks you, with facility, your Dane dead drunk; he sweats not to overthrow your Almain; he gives your Hollander a vomit ere the next pottle can be fill’d.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: To the health of our general!

speech.speaker: MON.
speech.line: I am for it, lieutenant; and I’ll do you justice.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: O sweet England!
“King Stephen was and—a worthy peer,
His breeches cost him but a crown;
He held them sixpence all too dear,
With that he call’d the tailor lown;
He was a wight of high renown,
And thou art but of low degree.
’Tis pride that pulls the country down,
Then take thy auld cloak about thee.”
Some wine ho!

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: ’Fore God, this is a more exquisite song than the other.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Will you hear’t again?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: No; for I hold him to be unworthy of his place that does those things. Well, God’s above all; and there be souls must be sav’d, and there be souls must not be sav’d.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: It’s true, good lieutenant.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: For mine own part—no offense to the general, nor any man of quality—I hope to be sav’d.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: And so do I too, lieutenant.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Ay; but by your leave, not before me; the lieutenant is to be sav’d before the ancient. Let’s have no more of this; let’s to our affairs.—God forgive us our sins!—Gentlemen, let’s look to our business. Do not think, gentlemen, I am drunk: this is my ancient, this is my right hand, and this is my left hand. I am not drunk now; I can stand well enough, and I speak well enough.

speech.speaker: ALL.
speech.line: Excellent well.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Why, very well then; you must not think then that I am drunk.

speech.speaker: MON.
speech.line: To th’ platform, masters, come, let’s set the watch.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: How now, Roderigo?
I pray you, after the lieutenant, go.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: ’Zounds, you rogue! You rascal!

speech.speaker: MON.
speech.line: What’s the matter, lieutenant?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: A knave teach me my duty? I’ll beat the knave into a twiggen bottle.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Beat me?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Dost thou prate, rogue?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Away, I say; go out and cry a mutiny.
Who’s that which rings the bell? Diablo, ho!
The town will rise. God’s will, lieutenant, hold!
You’ll be asham’d forever.

stagedir.dir: Enter Othello and Gentlemen with weapons.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Hold, for your lives!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Hold ho! Lieutenant—sir—Montano—gentlemen—
Have you forgot all place of sense and duty?
Hold! The general speaks to you; hold, for shame!

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Why, how now ho? From whence ariseth this?
Are we turn’d Turks, and to ourselves do that
Which heaven hath forbid the Ottomites?
For Christian shame, put by this barbarous brawl.
He that stirs next to carve for his own rage
Holds his soul light; he dies upon his motion.
Silence that dreadful bell, it frights the isle
From her propriety. What is the matter, masters?
Honest Iago, that looks dead with grieving,
Speak: who began this? On thy love, I charge thee!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: I do not know. Friends all, but now, even now;
In quarter, and in terms like bride and groom
Devesting them for bed; and then, but now
(As if some planet had unwitted men),
Swords out, and tilting one at other’s breast,
In opposition bloody. I cannot speak
Any beginning to this peevish odds;
And would in action glorious I had lost
Those legs that brought me to a part of it.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: How comes it, Michael, you are thus forgot?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I pray you pardon me, I cannot speak.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Worthy Montano, you were wont to be civil;
The gravity and stillness of your youth
The world hath noted, and your name is great
In mouths of wisest censure. What’s the matter
That you unlace your reputation thus,
And spend your rich opinion for the name
Of a night-brawler? Give me answer to it.

speech.speaker: MON.
speech.line: Worthy Othello, I am hurt to danger.
Your officer, Iago, can inform you—
While I spare speech, which something now offends me—
Of all that I do know, nor know I aught
By me that’s said or done amiss this night,
Unless self-charity be sometimes a vice,
And to defend ourselves it be a sin
When violence assails us.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Now by heaven,
My blood begins my safer guides to rule,
And passion, having my best judgment collied,
Assays to lead the way. ’Zounds, if I stir,
Or do but lift this arm, the best of you
Shall sink in my rebuke. Give me to know
How this foul rout began; who set it on;
And he that is approv’d in this offense,
Though he had twinn’d with me, both at a birth,
Shall lose me. What, in a town of war,
Yet wild, the people’s hearts brimful of fear,
To manage private and domestic quarrel?
In night, and on the court and guard of safety?
’Tis monstrous. Iago, who began’t?

speech.speaker: MON.
speech.line: If partially affin’d, or leagu’d in office,
Thou dost deliver more or less than truth,
Thou art no soldier.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Touch me not so near;
I had rather have this tongue cut from my mouth
Than it should do offense to Michael Cassio;
Yet I persuade myself, to speak the truth
Shall nothing wrong him. Thus it is, general:
Montano and myself being in speech,
There comes a fellow crying out for help,
And Cassio following him with determin’d sword
To execute upon him. Sir, this gentleman
Steps in to Cassio and entreats his pause;
Myself the crying fellow did pursue,
Lest by his clamor (as it so fell out)
The town might fall in fright. He, swift of foot,
Outran my purpose; and I return’d the rather
For that I heard the clink and fall of swords,
And Cassio high in oath; which till tonight
I ne’er might say before. When I came back
(For this was brief), I found them close together
At blow and thrust, even as again they were
When you yourself did part them.
More of this matter cannot I report.
But men are men; the best sometimes forget.
Though Cassio did some little wrong to him,
As men in rage strike those that wish them best,
Yet surely Cassio, I believe, receiv’d
From him that fled some strange indignity
Which patience could not pass.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: I know, Iago,
Thy honesty and love doth mince this matter,
Making it light to Cassio. Cassio, I love thee,
But never more be officer of mine.
Sir, for your hurts,
Myself will be your surgeon.—Lead him off.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: What, are you hurt, lieutenant?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Ay, past all surgery.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Marry, God forbid!

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Reputation, reputation, reputation! O, I have lost my reputation! I have lost the immortal part of myself, and what remains is bestial. My reputation, Iago, my reputation!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: As I am an honest man, I had thought you had receiv’d some bodily wound; there is more sense in that than in reputation. Reputation is an idle and most false imposition; oft got without merit, and lost without deserving. You have lost no reputation at all, unless you repute yourself such a loser. What, man, there are more ways to recover the general again. You are but now cast in his mood, a punishment more in policy than in malice, even so as one would beat his offenseless dog to affright an imperious lion. Sue to him again, and he’s yours.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I will rather sue to be despis’d than to deceive so good a commander with so slight, so drunken, and so indiscreet an officer. Drunk? And speak parrot? And squabble? Swagger? Swear? And discourse fustian with one’s own shadow? O thou invisible spirit of wine, if thou hast no name to be known by, let us call thee devil!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: What was he that you follow’d with your sword? What had he done to you?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I know not.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Is’t possible?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I remember a mass of things, but nothing distinctly; a quarrel, but nothing wherefore. O God, that men should put an enemy in their mouths to steal away their brains! That we should, with joy, pleasance, revel, and applause, transform ourselves into beasts!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Why, but you are now well enough. How came you thus recover’d?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: It hath pleas’d the devil drunkenness to give place to the devil wrath: one unperfectness shows me another, to make me frankly despise myself.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Come, you are too severe a moraler. As the time, the place, and the condition of this country stands, I could heartily wish this had not befall’n; but since it is as it is, mend it for your own good.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I will ask him for my place again, he shall tell me I am a drunkard! Had I as many mouths as Hydra, such an answer would stop them all. To be now a sensible man, by and by a fool, and presently a beast! O strange! Every inordinate cup is unbless’d, and the ingredient is a devil.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Come, come; good wine is a good familiar creature, if it be well us’d; exclaim no more against it. And, good lieutenant, I think you think I love you.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I have well approv’d it, sir. I drunk!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: You, or any man living, may be drunk at a time, man. I’ll tell you what you shall do. Our general’s wife is now the general—I may say so in this respect, for that he hath devoted and given up himself to the contemplation, mark, and denotement of her parts and graces. Confess yourself freely to her; importune her help to put you in your place again. She is of so free, so kind, so apt, so bless’d a disposition, she holds it a vice in her goodness not to do more than she is requested. This broken joint between you and her husband entreat her to splinter; and my fortunes against any lay worth naming, this crack of your love shall grow stronger than it was before.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: You advise me well.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: I protest, in the sincerity of love and honest kindness.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I think it freely; and betimes in the morning I will beseech the virtuous Desdemona to undertake for me. I am desperate of my fortunes if they check me here.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: You are in the right. Good night, lieutenant, I must to the watch.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Good night, honest Iago.
How now, Roderigo?

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: I do follow here in the chase, not like a hound that hunts, but one that fills up the cry. My money is almost spent; I have been tonight exceedingly well cudgell’d; and I think the issue will be, I shall have so much experience for my pains; and so, with no money at all and a little more wit, return again to Venice.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: How poor are they that have not patience!
What wound did ever heal but by degrees?
Thou know’st we work by wit, and not by witchcraft,
And wit depends on dilatory time.
Does’t not go well? Cassio hath beaten thee,
And thou by that small hurt hast cashier’d Cassio.
Though other things grow fair against the sun,
Yet fruits that blossom first will first be ripe.
Content thyself a while. By the mass, ’tis morning;
Pleasure and action make the hours seem short.
Retire thee, go where thou art billeted.
Away, I say, thou shalt know more hereafter.
Nay, get thee gone.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Dost thou hear, mine honest friend?

speech.speaker: CLO.
speech.line: No, I hear not your honest friend; I hear you.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Prithee keep up thy quillets. There’s a poor piece of gold for thee. If the gentlewoman that attends the general’s wife be stirring, tell her there’s one Cassio entreats her a little favor of speech. Wilt thou do this?

speech.speaker: CLO.
speech.line: She is stirring, sir. If she will stir hither, I shall seem to notify unto her.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Do, good my friend.
In happy time, Iago.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: You have not been a-bed then?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Why, no; the day had broke
Before we parted. I have made bold, Iago,
To send in to your wife. My suit to her
Is that she will to virtuous Desdemona
Procure me some access.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: I’ll send her to you presently;
And I’ll devise a mean to draw the Moor
Out of the way, that your converse and business
May be more free.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I humbly thank you for’t.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Good morrow, good lieutenant. I am sorry
For your displeasure; but all will sure be well.
The general and his wife are talking of it,
And she speaks for you stoutly. The Moor replies
That he you hurt is of great fame in Cyprus,
And great affinity; and that in wholesome wisdom
He might not but refuse you. But he protests he loves you,
And needs no other suitor but his likings
To take the safest occasion by the front
To bring you in again.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Yet I beseech you,
If you think fit, or that it may be done,
Give me advantage of some brief discourse
With Desdemon alone.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Pray you come in.
I will bestow you where you shall have time
To speak your bosom freely.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I am much bound to you.

scene.scenelocation: Cyprus. A room in the castle.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Be thou assur’d, good Cassio, I will do
All my abilities in thy behalf.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Good madam, do. I warrant it grieves my husband
As if the cause were his.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: O, that’s an honest fellow. Do not doubt, Cassio,
But I will have my lord and you again
As friendly as you were.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Bounteous madam,
What ever shall become of Michael Cassio,
He’s never any thing but your true servant.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: I know’t; I thank you. You do love my lord;
You have known him long, and be you well assur’d
He shall in strangeness stand no farther off
Than in a politic distance.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Ay, but, lady,
That policy may either last so long,
Or feed upon such nice and waterish diet,
Or breed itself so out of circumstances,
That I being absent and my place supplied,
My general will forget my love and service.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Do not doubt that; before Emilia here,
I give thee warrant of thy place. Assure thee,
If I do vow a friendship, I’ll perform it
To the last article. My lord shall never rest,
I’ll watch him tame, and talk him out of patience;
His bed shall seem a school, his board a shrift,
I’ll intermingle every thing he does
With Cassio’s suit. Therefore be merry, Cassio,
For thy solicitor shall rather die
Than give thy cause away.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Hah? I like not that.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: What dost thou say?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Nothing, my lord; or if—I know not what.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Was not that Cassio parted from my wife?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Cassio, my lord? No, sure, I cannot think it,
That he would steal away so guilty-like,
Seeing your coming.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: I do believe ’twas he.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: How now, my lord?
I have been talking with a suitor here,
A man that languishes in your displeasure.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Who is’t you mean?

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Why, your lieutenant, Cassio. Good my lord,
If I have any grace or power to move you,
His present reconciliation take;
For if he be not one that truly loves you,
That errs in ignorance and not in cunning,
I have no judgment in an honest face.
I prithee call him back.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Went he hence now?

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Yes, faith; so humbled
That he hath left part of his grief with me
To suffer with him. Good love, call him back.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Not now, sweet Desdemon, some other time.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: But shall’t be shortly?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: The sooner, sweet, for you.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Shall’t be tonight at supper?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: No, not tonight.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Tomorrow dinner then?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: I shall not dine at home;
I meet the captains at the citadel.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Why then tomorrow night, or Tuesday morn;
On Tuesday noon, or night; on We’n’sday morn.
I prithee name the time, but let it not
Exceed three days. In faith, he’s penitent;
And yet his trespass, in our common reason
(Save that they say the wars must make example
Out of her best), is not almost a fault
T’ incur a private check. When shall he come?
Tell me, Othello. I wonder in my soul
What you would ask me that I should deny,
Or stand so mamm’ring on. What? Michael Cassio,
That came a-wooing with you, and so many a time,
When I have spoke of you dispraisingly,
Hath ta’en your part—to have so much to do
To bring him in! By’r lady, I could do much—

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Prithee no more; let him come when he will;
I will deny thee nothing.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Why, this is not a boon;
’Tis as I should entreat you wear your gloves,
Or feed on nourishing dishes, or keep you warm,
Or sue to you to do a peculiar profit
To your own person. Nay, when I have a suit
Wherein I mean to touch your love indeed,
It shall be full of poise and difficult weight,
And fearful to be granted.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: I will deny thee nothing;
Whereon, I do beseech thee, grant me this,
To leave me but a little to myself.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Shall I deny you? No. Farewell, my lord.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Farewell, my Desdemona, I’ll come to thee straight.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Emilia, come.—Be as your fancies teach you;
What e’er you be, I am obedient.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: This fellow’s of exceeding honesty,
And knows all qualities, with a learned spirit,
Of human dealings. If I do prove her haggard,
Though that her jesses were my dear heart-strings,
I’ld whistle her off, and let her down the wind
To prey at fortune. Haply, for I am black,
And have not those soft parts of conversation
That chamberers have, or for I am declin’d
Into the vale of years (yet that’s not much),
She’s gone. I am abus’d, and my relief
Must be to loathe her. O curse of marriage!
That we can call these delicate creatures ours,
And not their appetites! I had rather be a toad
And live upon the vapor of a dungeon
Than keep a corner in the thing I love
For others’ uses. Yet ’tis the plague of great ones,
Prerogativ’d are they less than the base;
’Tis destiny unshunnable, like death.
Even then this forked plague is fated to us
When we do quicken. Look where she comes:

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: I am glad I have found this napkin;
This was her first remembrance from the Moor.
My wayward husband hath a hundred times
Woo’d me to steal it; but she so loves the token
(For he conjur’d her she should ever keep it)
That she reserves it evermore about her
To kiss and talk to. I’ll have the work ta’en out,
And give’t Iago. What he will do with it
Heaven knows, not I;
I nothing but to please his fantasy.
I will in Cassio’s lodging lose this napkin,
And let him find it. Trifles light as air
Are to the jealous confirmations strong
As proofs of holy writ; this may do something.
The Moor already changes with my poison:
Dangerous conceits are in their natures poisons,
Which at the first are scarce found to distaste,
But with a little act upon the blood
Burn like the mines of sulphur.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Do you know, sirrah, where Lieutenant Cassio lies?

speech.speaker: CLO.
speech.line: I dare not say he lies any where.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Why, man?

speech.speaker: CLO.
speech.line: He’s a soldier, and for me to say a soldier lies, ’tis stabbing.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Go to! Where lodges he?

speech.speaker: CLO.
speech.line: To tell you where he lodges, is to tell you where I lie.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Can any thing be made of this?

speech.speaker: CLO.
speech.line: I know not where he lodges, and for me to devise a lodging and say he lies here, or he lies there, were to lie in mine own throat.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Can you inquire him out, and be edified by report?

speech.speaker: CLO.
speech.line: I will catechize the world for him, that is, make questions, and by them answer.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Seek him, bid him come hither. Tell him I have mov’d my lord on his behalf, and hope all will be well.

speech.speaker: CLO.
speech.line: To do this is within the compass of man’s wit, and therefore I will attempt the doing it.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: I will not leave him now till Cassio
Be call’d to him.—How is’t with you, my lord?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Well, my good lady.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Is not this man jealous?

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: I nev’r saw this before.
Sure, there’s some wonder in this handkerchief;
I am most unhappy in the loss of it.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: ’Tis not a year or two shows us a man:
They are all but stomachs, and we all but food;
They eat us hungerly, and when they are full
They belch us.
Something sure of state,
Either from Venice, or some unhatch’d practice
Made demonstrable here in Cyprus to him,
Hath puddled his clear spirit; and in such cases
Men’s natures wrangle with inferior things,
Though great ones are their object. ’Tis even so;
For let our finger ache, and it endues
Our other healthful members even to a sense
Of pain. Nay, we must think men are not gods,
Nor of them look for such observancy
As fits the bridal. Beshrew me much, Emilia,
I was (unhandsome warrior as I am)
Arraigning his unkindness with my soul;
But now I find I had suborn’d the witness,
And he’s indicted falsely.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Pray heaven it be state matters, as you think,
And no conception nor no jealous toy
Concerning you.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Alas the day, I never gave him cause.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: But jealous souls will not be answer’d so;
They are not ever jealous for the cause,
But jealous for they’re jealous. It is a monster
Begot upon itself, born on itself.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Heaven keep the monster from Othello’s mind!

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Lady, amen.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: I will go seek him. Cassio, walk hereabout;
If I do find him fit, I’ll move your suit
And seek to effect it to my uttermost.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I humbly thank your ladyship.

speech.speaker: BIAN.
speech.line: ’Save you, friend Cassio!

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: What make you from home?
How is’t with you, my most fair Bianca?
I’faith, sweet love, I was coming to your house.

speech.speaker: BIAN.
speech.line: And I was going to your lodging, Cassio.
What? Keep a week away? Seven days and nights?
Eightscore eight hours? And lovers’ absent hours,
More tedious than the dial eightscore times?
O weary reck’ning!

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Pardon me, Bianca.
I have this while with leaden thoughts been press’d,
But I shall in a more continuate time
Strike off this score of absence. Sweet Bianca,
Take me this work out.

speech.speaker: BIAN.
speech.line: O Cassio, whence came this?
This is some token from a newer friend;
To the felt absence now I feel a cause.
Is’t come to this? Well, well.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Go to, woman!
Throw your vild guesses in the devil’s teeth,
From whence you have them. You are jealous now
That this is from some mistress, some remembrance;
No, by my faith, Bianca.

speech.speaker: BIAN.
speech.line: Why, whose is it?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I know not, neither; I found it in my chamber.
I like the work well; ere it be demanded
(As like enough it will) I would have it copied.
Take it, and do’t, and leave me for this time.

speech.speaker: BIAN.
speech.line: Leave you? Wherefore?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I do attend here on the general,
And think it no addition, nor my wish,
To have him see me woman’d.

speech.speaker: BIAN.
speech.line: Why, I pray you?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Not that I love you not.

speech.speaker: BIAN.
speech.line: But that you do not love me.
I pray you bring me on the way a little,
And say if I shall see you soon at night.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: ’Tis but a little way that I can bring you,
For I attend here; but I’ll see you soon.

speech.speaker: BIAN.
speech.line: ’Tis very good; I must be circumstanc’d.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Will you think so?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Think so, Iago?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: What,
To kiss in private?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: An unauthoriz’d kiss!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Or to be naked with her friend in bed
An hour, or more, not meaning any harm?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Naked in bed, Iago, and not mean harm?
It is hypocrisy against the devil.
They that mean virtuously, and yet do so,
The devil their virtue tempts, and they tempt heaven.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: If they do nothing, ’tis a venial slip;
But if I give my wife a handkerchief—

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: What then?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Why then ’tis hers, my lord, and being hers,
She may, I think, bestow’t on any man.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: She is protectress of her honor too;
May she give that?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Her honor is an essence that’s not seen;
They have it very oft that have it not.
But for the handkerchief—

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: By heaven, I would most gladly have forgot it.
Thou saidst (O, it comes o’er my memory,
As doth the raven o’er the infectious house,
Boding to all) he had my handkerchief.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Ay; what of that?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: That’s not so good now.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: What
If I had said I had seen him do you wrong?
Or heard him say—as knaves be such abroad,
Who having by their own importunate suit,
Or voluntary dotage of some mistress,
Convinced or supplied them, cannot choose
But they must blab—

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Hath he said any thing?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: He hath, my lord, but be you well assur’d,
No more than he’ll unswear.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: What hath he said?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Faith, that he did—I know not what he did.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: What? What?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Lie—

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: With her?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: With her? On her; what you will.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Lie with her? Lie on her? We say lie on her, when they belie her. Lie with her! ’Zounds, that’s fulsome! Handkerchief—confessions—handkerchief! To confess, and be hang’d for his labor—first to be hang’d, and then to confess. I tremble at it. Nature would not invest herself in such shadowing passion without some instruction. It is not words that shakes me thus. Pish! Noses, ears, and lips. Is’t possible? Confess? Handkerchief? O devil!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Work on,
My medicine, work! Thus credulous fools are caught,
And many worthy and chaste dames even thus
(All guiltless) meet reproach.—What ho! My lord!
My lord, I say! Othello!
How is it, general? Have you not hurt your head?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Dost thou mock me?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: I mock you not, by heaven.
Would you would bear your fortune like a man!

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: A horned man’s a monster and a beast.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: There’s many a beast then in a populous city,
And many a civil monster.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Did he confess it?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Good sir, be a man;
Think every bearded fellow that’s but yok’d
May draw with you. There’s millions now alive
That nightly lie in those unproper beds
Which they dare swear peculiar; your case is better.
O, ’tis the spite of hell, the fiend’s arch-mock,
To lip a wanton in a secure couch,
And to suppose her chaste! No, let me know,
And knowing what I am, I know what she shall be.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: O, thou art wise; ’tis certain.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Stand you a while apart,
Confine yourself but in a patient list.
Whilst you were here o’erwhelmed with your grief
(A passion most unsuiting such a man),
Cassio came hither. I shifted him away,
And laid good ’scuses upon your ecstasy;
Bade him anon return and here speak with me,
The which he promis’d. Do but encave yourself,
And mark the fleers, the gibes, and notable scorns
That dwell in every region of his face,
For I will make him tell the tale anew:
Where, how, how oft, how long ago, and when
He hath, and is again to cope your wife.
I say, but mark his gesture. Marry, patience,
Or I shall say y’ are all in all in spleen,
And nothing of a man.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Dost thou hear, Iago,
I will be found most cunning in my patience;
But (dost thou hear) most bloody.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: That’s not amiss,
But yet keep time in all. Will you withdraw?
Now will I question Cassio of Bianca,
A huswife that by selling her desires
Buys herself bread and clothes. It is a creature
That dotes on Cassio (as ’tis the strumpet’s plague
To beguile many and be beguil’d by one);
He, when he hears of her, cannot restrain
From the excess of laughter. Here he comes.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: ’Tis such another fitchew! Marry, a perfum’d one!—What do you mean by this haunting of me?

speech.speaker: BIAN.
speech.line: Let the devil and his dam haunt you! What did you mean by that same handkerchief you gave me even now? I was a fine fool to take it. I must take out the work? A likely piece of work, that you should find it in your chamber, and know not who left it there! This is some minx’s token, and I must take out the work? There, give it your hobby-horse. Wheresoever you had it, I’ll take out no work on’t.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: How now, my sweet Bianca? How now? How now?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: By heaven, that should be my handkerchief!

speech.speaker: BIAN.
speech.line: An’ you’ll come to supper tonight, you may; an’ you will not, come when you are next prepar’d for.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: How shall I murder him, Iago?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Did you perceive how he laugh’d at his vice?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: O Iago!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: And did you see the handkerchief?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Was that mine?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Yours, by this hand. And to see how he prizes the foolish woman your wife! She gave it him, and he hath giv’n it his whore.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: I would have him nine years a-killing. A fine woman! A fair woman! A sweet woman!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Nay, you must forget that.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Ay, let her rot, and perish, and be damn’d tonight, for she shall not live. No, my heart is turn’d to stone; I strike it, and it hurts my hand. O, the world hath not a sweeter creature! She might lie by an emperor’s side and command him tasks.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Nay, that’s not your way.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Hang her, I do but say what she is. So delicate with her needle! An admirable musician! O, she will sing the savageness out of a bear. Of so high and plenteous wit and invention!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: She’s the worse for all this.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: O, a thousand, a thousand times. And then of so gentle a condition!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Ay, too gentle.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Nay, that’s certain. But yet the pity of it, Iago! O Iago, the pity of it, Iago!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: If you are so fond over her iniquity, give her patent to offend, for if it touch not you, it comes near nobody.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: I will chop her into messes. Cuckold me!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: O, ’tis foul in her.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: With mine officer!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: That’s fouler.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Get me some poison, Iago, this night. I’ll not expostulate with her, lest her body and beauty unprovide my mind again. This night, Iago.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Do it not with poison; strangle her in her bed, even the bed she hath contaminated.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Good, good; the justice of it pleases; very good.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: And for Cassio, let me be his undertaker.
You shall hear more by midnight.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Excellent good.
’Tis Lodovico—
This comes from the Duke. See, your wife’s with him.

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: God save you, worthy general!

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: With all my heart, sir.

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: The Duke and the senators of Venice greet you.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: I kiss the instrument of their pleasures.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: And what’s the news, good cousin Lodovico?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: I am very glad to see you, signior;
Welcome to Cyprus.

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: I thank you. How does Lieutenant Cassio?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Lives, sir.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Cousin, there’s fall’n between him and my lord
An unkind breach; but you shall make all well.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Are you sure of that?

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: My lord?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Devil!

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: I have not deserv’d this.

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: My lord, this would not be believ’d in Venice,
Though I should swear I saw’t. ’Tis very much,
Make her amends; she weeps.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: O devil, devil!
If that the earth could teem with woman’s tears,
Each drop she falls would prove a crocodile.
Out of my sight!

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: I will not stay to offend you.

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: Truly, an obedient lady:
I do beseech your lordship call her back.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Mistress!

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: My lord?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: What would you with her, sir?

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: Who, I, my lord?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Ay, you did wish that I would make her turn.
Sir, she can turn, and turn; and yet go on
And turn again; and she can weep, sir, weep;
And she’s obedient, as you say, obedient;
Very obedient—Proceed you in your tears.—
Concerning this, sir—O well-painted passion!—
I am commanded home.—Get you away;
I’ll send for you anon.—Sir, I obey the mandate,
And will return to Venice.—Hence, avaunt!

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: Is this the noble Moor whom our full Senate
Call all in all sufficient? Is this the nature
Whom passion could not shake? Whose solid virtue
The shot of accident nor dart of chance
Could neither graze nor pierce?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: He is much chang’d.

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: Are his wits safe? Is he not light of brain?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: He’s that he is; I may not breathe my censure
What he might be. If what he might he is not,
I would to heaven he were!

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: What? Strike his wife?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Faith, that was not so well; yet would I knew
That stroke would prove the worst!

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: Is it his use?
Or did the letters work upon his blood,
And new-create this fault?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Alas, alas!
It is not honesty in me to speak
What I have seen and known. You shall observe him,
And his own courses will denote him so
That I may save my speech. Do but go after,
And mark how he continues.

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: I am sorry that I am deceiv’d in him.

scene.scenelocation: Cyprus. A room in the castle.
scene.line: She says enough; yet she’s a simple bawd
That cannot say as much. This is a subtile whore,
A closet lock and key of villainous secrets;
And yet she’ll kneel and pray; I have seen her do’t.
Some of your function, mistress;
Leave procreants alone, and shut the door;
Cough, or cry “hem,” if anybody come.
Your mystery, your mystery; nay, dispatch.
That have the office opposite to Saint Peter,
And keeps the gate of hell! You, you! Ay, you!
We have done our course; there’s money for your pains.
I pray you turn the key and keep our counsel.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: ’Tis meet I should be us’d so, very meet.
How have I been behav’d, that he might stick
The small’st opinion on my least misuse?

scene.line: Hark how these instruments summon to supper!
The messengers of Venice stays the meat.
Go in, and weep not; all things shall be well.
How now, Roderigo?

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: I do not find that thou deal’st justly with me.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: What in the contrary?

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Every day thou daff’st me with some device, Iago, and rather, as it seems to me now, keep’st from me all conveniency than suppliest me with the least advantage of hope. I will indeed no longer endure it; nor am I yet persuaded to put up in peace what already I have foolishly suff’red.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Will you hear me, Roderigo?

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Faith, I have heard too much; for your words and performances are no kin together.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: You charge me most unjustly.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: With nought but truth. I have wasted myself out of my means. The jewels you have had from me to deliver Desdemona would half have corrupted a votarist. You have told me she hath receiv’d them and return’d me expectations and comforts of sudden respect and acquaintance, but I find none.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Well, go to; very well.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Very well! Go to! I cannot go to, man, nor ’tis not very well. By this hand, I think it is scurvy, and begin to find myself fopp’d in it.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Very well.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: I tell you ’tis not very well. I will make myself known to Desdemona. If she will return me my jewels, I will give over my suit and repent my unlawful solicitation; if not, assure yourself I will seek satisfaction of you.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: You have said now.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Ay; and said nothing but what I protest intendment of doing.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Why, now I see there’s mettle in thee, and even from this instant do build on thee a better opinion than ever before. Give me thy hand, Roderigo. Thou hast taken against me a most just exception; but yet I protest I have dealt most directly in thy affair.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: It hath not appear’d.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: I grant indeed it hath not appear’d; and your suspicion is not without wit and judgment. But, Roderigo, if thou hast that in thee indeed, which I have greater reason to believe now than ever (I mean purpose, courage, and valor), this night show it. If thou the next night following enjoy not Desdemona, take me from this world with treachery and devise engines for my life.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Well; what is it? Is it within reason and compass?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Sir, there is especial commission come from Venice to depute Cassio in Othello’s place.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: Is that true? Why then Othello and Desdemona return again to Venice.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: O no; he goes into Mauritania and taketh away with him the fair Desdemona, unless his abode be ling’red here by some accident; wherein none can be so determinate as the removing of Cassio.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: How do you mean, removing him?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Why, by making him uncapable of Othello’s place: knocking out his brains.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: And that you would have me to do?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Ay; if you dare do yourself a profit and a right. He sups tonight with a harlotry, and thither will I go to him—he knows not yet of his honorable fortune. If you will watch his going thence (which I will fashion to fall out between twelve and one), you may take him at your pleasure. I will be near to second your attempt, and he shall fall between us. Come, stand not amaz’d at it, but go along with me; I will show you such a necessity in his death that you shall think yourself bound to put it on him. It is now high supper-time, and the night grows to waste. About it.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: I will hear further reason for this.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: And you shall be satisfied.

scene.scenelocation: Cyprus. Another room in the castle.

stagedir.dir: Enter Othello, Lodovico, Desdemona, Emilia, and Attendants.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: How goes it now? He looks gentler than he did.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: He says he will return incontinent,
And hath commanded me to go to bed,
And bid me to dismiss you.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Dismiss me?

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: It was his bidding; therefore, good Emilia,
Give me my nightly wearing, and adieu.
We must not now displease him.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: I would you had never seen him!

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: So would not I. My love doth so approve him,
That even his stubbornness, his checks, his frowns—
Prithee unpin me—have grace and favor in them.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: I have laid those sheets you bade me on the bed.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: All’s one. Good faith, how foolish are our minds!
If I do die before thee, prithee shroud me
In one of these same sheets.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Come, come; you talk.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: My mother had a maid call’d Barbary;
She was in love, and he she lov’d prov’d mad,
And did forsake her. She had a song of “Willow,”
An old thing ’twas, but it express’d her fortune,
And she died singing it. That song tonight
Will not go from my mind; I have much to do
But to go hang my head all at one side
And sing it like poor Barbary. Prithee dispatch.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Shall I go fetch your night-gown?

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: No, unpin me here.
This Lodovico is a proper man.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: A very handsome man.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: He speaks well.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: I know a lady in Venice would have walk’d barefoot to Palestine for a touch of his nether lip.

scene.speaker: DES.
scene.line: “— willow, willow”—
Prithee hie thee; he’ll come anon—
“I call’d my love false love; but what said he then?
Sing willow, willow, willow;
If I court more women, you’ll couch with more men.”—
So get thee gone, good night. Mine eyes do itch;
Doth that bode weeping?

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: ’Tis neither here nor there.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: I have heard it said so. O, these men, these men!
Dost thou in conscience think—tell me, Emilia—
That there be women do abuse their husbands
In such gross kind?

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: There be some such, no question.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Wouldst thou do such a deed for all the world?

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Why, would not you?

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: No, by this heavenly light!

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Nor I neither by this heavenly light;
I might do’t as well i’ th’ dark.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Wouldst thou do such a deed for all the world?

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: The world’s a huge thing; it is a great price
For a small vice.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Good troth, I think thou wouldst not.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: By my troth, I think I should, and undo’t when I had done’t. Marry, I would not do such a thing for a joint-ring, nor for measures of lawn, nor for gowns, petticoats, nor caps, nor any petty exhibition; but, for all the whole world—’ud’s pity, who would not make her husband a cuckold to make him a monarch? I should venture purgatory for’t.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Beshrew me, if I would do such a wrong
For the whole world.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Why, the wrong is but a wrong i’ th’ world; and having the world for your labor, ’tis a wrong in your own world, and you might quickly make it right.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: I do not think there is any such woman.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: Yes, a dozen; and as many to th’ vantage as would store the world they play’d for.
But I do think it is their husbands’ faults
If wives do fall. Say that they slack their duties,
And pour our treasures into foreign laps;
Or else break out in peevish jealousies,
Throwing restraint upon us; or say they strike us,
Or scant our former having in despite:
Why, we have galls; and though we have some grace,
Yet have we some revenge. Let husbands know
Their wives have sense like them; they see, and smell,
And have their palates both for sweet and sour,
As husbands have. What is it that they do
When they change us for others? Is it sport?
I think it is. And doth affection breed it?
I think it doth. Is’t frailty that thus errs?
It is so too. And have not we affections,
Desires for sport, and frailty, as men have?
Then let them use us well; else let them know,
The ills we do, their ills instruct us so.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Good night, good night. God me such uses send,
Not to pick bad from bad, but by bad mend.

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: I know his gait, ’tis he.—Villain, thou diest!

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: O, I am slain.

stagedir.dir: Iago from behind wounds Cassio in the leg, and exit.

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I am maim’d forever. Help ho! Murder, murder!

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: Hark!

speech.speaker: GRA.
speech.line: Here’s one comes in his shirt, with light and weapons.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Who’s there? Whose noise is this that cries on murder?

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: We do not know.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Did not you hear a cry?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Here, here! For heaven sake help me!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: What’s the matter?

speech.speaker: GRA.
speech.line: This is Othello’s ancient, as I take it.

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: The same indeed, a very valiant fellow.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: What are you here that cry so grievously?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: Iago? O, I am spoil’d, undone by villains!
Give me some help.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: O me, lieutenant! What villains have done this?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: I think that one of them is hereabout,
And cannot make away.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: O treacherous villains!

speech.speaker: ROD.
speech.line: O damn’d Iago! O inhuman dog!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Kill men i’ th’ dark?—Where be these bloody thieves?—
How silent is this town!—Ho, murder, murder!—
What may you be? Are you of good or evil?

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: As you shall prove us, praise us.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Signior Lodovico?

speech.speaker: LOD.
speech.line: He, sir.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: I cry you mercy. Here’s Cassio hurt by villains.

speech.speaker: GRA.
speech.line: Cassio?

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: How is’t, brother?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: My leg is cut in two.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Marry, heaven forbid!
Light, gentlemen! I’ll bind it with my shirt.
For you, mistress,
Save you your labor.—He that lies slain here, Cassio,
Was my dear friend. What malice was between you?

speech.speaker: CAS.
speech.line: None in the world; nor do I know the man.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Stay you, good gentlemen.—Look you pale, mistress?—
Do you perceive the gastness of her eye?—
Nay, an’ you stare, we shall hear more anon.—
Behold her well; I pray you look upon her.
Do you see, gentlemen? Nay, guiltiness will speak,
Though tongues were out of use.

scene.line: What, do you shake at that?

speech.speaker: BIAN.
speech.line: He supp’d at my house, but I therefore shake not.

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: O, did he so? I charge you go with me.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: O fie upon thee, strumpet!

speech.speaker: BIAN.
speech.line: I am no strumpet, but of life as honest
As you that thus abuse me.

speech.speaker: EMIL.
speech.line: As I? Fough, fie upon thee!

speech.speaker: IAGO.
speech.line: Kind gentlemen, let’s go see poor Cassio dress’d.
Come, mistress, you must tell ’s another tale.
Emilia, run you to the citadel,
And tell my lord and lady what hath happ’d.—
Will you go on afore?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: It is the cause, it is the cause, my soul;
Let me not name it to you, you chaste stars,
It is the cause. Yet I’ll not shed her blood,
Nor scar that whiter skin of hers than snow,
And smooth as monumental alabaster.
Yet she must die, else she’ll betray more men.
Put out the light, and then put out the light:
If I quench thee, thou flaming minister,
I can again thy former light restore,
Should I repent me; but once put out thy light,
Thou cunning’st pattern of excelling nature,
I know not where is that Promethean heat
That can thy light relume. When I have pluck’d thy rose,
I cannot give it vital growth again,
It needs must wither. I’ll smell thee on the tree.
O balmy breath, that dost almost persuade
Justice to break her sword! One more, one more.
Be thus when thou art dead, and I will kill thee
And love thee after. One more, and that’s the last.
So sweet was ne’er so fatal. I must weep,
But they are cruel tears. This sorrow’s heavenly,
It strikes where it doth love. She wakes.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Who’s there? Othello?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Ay, Desdemona.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Will you come to bed, my lord?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Have you pray’d tonight, Desdemon?

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Ay, my lord.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: If you bethink yourself of any crime
Unreconcil’d as yet to heaven and grace,
Solicit for it straight.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Alack, my lord, what may you mean by that?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Well, do it, and be brief, I will walk by.
I would not kill thy unprepared spirit,
No, heaven forefend! I would not kill thy soul.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Talk you of killing?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Ay, I do.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Then heaven
Have mercy on me!

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Amen, with all my heart!

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: If you say so, I hope you will not kill me.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Humh!

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: And yet I fear you; for you’re fatal then
When your eyes roll so. Why I should fear I know not,
Since guiltiness I know not; but yet I feel I fear.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Think on thy sins.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: They are loves I bear to you.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Ay, and for that thou di’st.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: That death’s unnatural that kills for loving.
Alas, why gnaw you so your nether lip?
Some bloody passion shakes your very frame.
These are portents; but yet I hope, I hope,
They do not point on me.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Peace, and be still!

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: I will so. What’s the matter?

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: That handkerchief which I so lov’d, and gave thee,
Thou gav’st to Cassio.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: No, by my life and soul!
Send for the man, and ask him.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Sweet soul, take heed,
Take heed of perjury, thou art on thy death-bed.

speech.speaker: DES.
speech.line: Ay, but not yet to die.

speech.speaker: OTH.
speech.line: Yes, presently:
